alert.note: Alert for McKinley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 4:28PM MDT until August 04 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central New Mexico, including the following county, McKinley. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 426 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain ending around Yah-Ta-Hey. Up to 1.45 inches of rain have fallen. The Emergency Manager reported water over Routes 491 and 264 slowing traffic down significantly. Law enforcement is engaged in traffic control. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yah-Ta-Hey, Rock Springs and Twin Lakes. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 near Mile Marker 13. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
